page.title: 03RAGDALE, LEICESTERSHIRE _ 2
page.content:
The road winds down into the village of Ragdale from Hoby, twisting its way between the collection of red brick houses, some old and some recently built, and climbs sharply up the other side of the valley towards the area known as Six Hills.
In the centre of the village there is a large farm whose owner has a herd of pedigree charolais cattle. They can be seen grazing on the pasture above the farm.
There are no pubs or shops in the village and no school or bus service. Residents are either farmers or commuters who work in nearby towns and cities.
